cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW across the southwest Atlantic, then turning NW toward the North and South Carolina coastline before drifting inland toward the Mid-Atlantic

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued yet (watches anticipated Tuesday for the Carolina coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest impacts expected along the North and South Carolina coastline with swell and rip currents extending northward along the entire U.S. East Coast
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (depending on inland track after landfall)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤3%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusty winds possible Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; only minor astronomical-tide related rises possible
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate to heavy rain could reach the port Saturday–Sunday with potential totals 2–4+ inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents throughout the week prior to closest approach
